title: Pesticide Handling & Application
description: Requirements for pesticide handling and application including documented procedures for mixing, loading, transporting, applying, disposal, equipment cleaning, applicator competency, and applicator training and supervision

requirements.text: Is there a documented procedure that is followed for the pesticide applications, considering mixing and loading, transporting, applying, surplus mix/tank rinsate disposal and equipment cleaning?
mandatoryStatements: Documented pesticide application procedure exists
Procedure covers mixing and loading of pesticides
Procedure covers safe transport of pesticides and spray equipment
Procedure covers application methods and techniques
Procedure covers disposal of surplus pesticide mix
Procedure covers disposal of tank rinsate
Procedure covers equipment cleaning after application
Procedure addresses safety and environmental protection
Procedure is followed for all pesticide applications
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of pesticide handling procedures, quarterly verification that procedures are followed
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Observation of pesticide handling activities to verify procedure compliance

requirements.text: Is there documentation that shows the individual(s) making decisions for pesticide applications is competent?
mandatoryStatements: Individual(s) making pesticide application decisions are identified
Documentation demonstrates competency of decision makers
Competency documentation may include licenses, certifications, training records
Decision makers have appropriate education or experience in pest management
Decision makers understand pesticide labels, regulations, and safety
Competency documentation is current and maintained on file
Only competent individuals authorize pesticide applications
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification of decision maker competency documentation currency
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Verification that only authorized competent persons make pesticide decisions

requirements.text: Is there documentation that shows that individuals who handle pesticide materials are trained and are under the supervision of a trained person?
mandatoryStatements: All individuals handling pesticides are trained
Training documentation is maintained for all pesticide handlers
Training covers safe handling, mixing, application, and disposal
Training covers label comprehension and compliance
Training covers personal protective equipment (PPE) use
Training covers emergency response procedures
Handlers work under supervision of trained/qualified person
Training is refreshed periodically and when procedures change
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly verification that all pesticide handlers have current training
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Verification of training before allowing individuals to handle pesticides, observation of supervision during operations

capaInject: If pesticide handling procedures not documented: develop procedures within 14 days, implement immediately, train personnel within 7 days
If decision maker competency not documented: obtain documentation within 14 days, interim supervision by qualified person until documented
If pesticide handlers not trained: immediate training before further pesticide handling, enhanced supervision until training complete
If procedures not followed: immediate correction, retraining within 7 days, enhanced monitoring for 30 days
traceabilityInject: Pesticide application decisions must be traceable to specific competent individuals
Pesticide handler training must be traceable to specific individuals, dates, and training content
Pesticide applications must be traceable to trained and supervised handlers
Supervision records should link handlers to qualified supervisors
